name: undiscouraged
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having lost your confidence or enthusiasm for something: Undiscouraged by the recollection of previous years, he planned another big family get-together. She wanted to travel, and was undiscouraged by government advice to stay at home.
More examplesFewer examplesHe looked across at the girls, quite undiscouraged when they didn't return his smile.Undiscouraged, the company stepped up its efforts for international recognition this year.She raced ahead, only to shoot wide, or be stopped by the goalie, but she seemed undiscouraged by her failure.
